subject: p16334516
History: A-year-old man with renal transplant in, diabetes, with nausea, vomiting and diarrhea for five weeks. Admitted with septic shock likely due to healthcare associated pneumonia and acute kidney insufficiency, hyperkalemia and hypotension. Now extubated.
Findings: AP chest compared to through : Consolidation in the left lung continues to improve. Now one can see mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema. Moderate right pleural effusion is smaller. Heart size is normal, and there is no mediastinal vascular engorgement. Feeding tube with the wire stylet in place ends in the upper stomach. A left internal jugular Swan-Ganz catheter ends in the right pulmonary artery. There is no pneumothorax.
